channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Contained - Brush Fire; INC#1383; 05:43PM; 11360 N Alethea Dr; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3zeYQuZ" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3zeYQuZ</a>; #Sunland; First arriving LAFD, LACoFD and ANF firefighters have full (100%) containment of the fire at one-eighth (0.125) acre of light-to-medium brush. No structure damage. No evacuation. Law enforcement will soon be reopening Big Tujunga Canyon Road in both directions between Mt. Gleason Avenue and Big Canyon Drive as firefighting operations are complete. The cause of the fire is under investigation. This incident was known as the #NationalFire.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 BP74 E274 E289 E60 E7 E77 E86 E89 E90 E98 EM14 H1 H3 H5 HA1 HA3 HA5 RA77 RA89 T74 T89 + LACoFD + ANF; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1383; 05:43PM; 11360 N Alethea Dr; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3zeYQuZ" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3zeYQuZ</a>; #Sunland; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response with Los Angeles County (LACoFD) and Angeles National Forest (ANF) Firefighters to less than one (1) acre light-to-medium brush burning in a Mutual Threat Zone near the agencies' common border. No structure threat. No evacuation. Law enforcement has been requested to close Big Tujunga Canyon Road in both directions between Mt. Gleason Avenue and Big Canyon Drive until firefighting operations are complete. This incident is known as the #NationalFire.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 E274 E289 E60 E7 E77 E86 E89 E90 E98 EM14 H1 H3 H5 HA1 HA3 HA5 RA77 RA89 T74 T89 + LACoFD + ANF; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire 06/21/2024 INC#0557

item.description: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0557; 11:55AM; 955 S Kenmore Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3RD4Ync" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3RD4Ync</a>; #Koreatown; The earlier missing dog - a 15-year-old Maltese named "Marty McFly", appears to have safely escaped when the adult male resident attempted to re-enter the burning home. The man has adamantly declined recommended transportation by ambulance to an area hospital for further evaluation of his smoke inhalation and minor thermal injury. During fire attack, one LAFD Firefighter sustained a sizable deep tissue laceration to the back of his left hand. He has received clinical care and been placed off duty to heal. No other injuries have been reported. Though the fire's cause has yet to be formally determined, the investigation is currently focused on a handful of small lithium-ion batteries (charging?) on the patio, that may prove to be the origin of the fire.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC18 BC6 CM20 CM22 E10 E13 E15 E203 E215 E220 E226 E26 E29 E3 EM11 HR3 JT3 RA29 RA803 RA811 RA813 SO1 SQ21 T15 T20 T26 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 06/21/2024 INC#0557

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0557; 10:15AM; 955 S Kenmore Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3RD4Ync" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3RD4Ync</a>; #Koreatown; First arriving 30 LAFD Firefighters took just 19 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish flames within the 1300 square foot one-story home (built 1901) that was well involved on their arrival. Firefighters prevented flames from damaging the pair of adjacent two-story apartment buildings. Early reports from 9-1-1 callers that one or more occupants of the burning home were reluctant to leave - and remained trapped inside, proved unfounded. However... one adult male resident who safely self-evacuated prior to LAFD arrival, decided to re-enter the burning home in an attempt to rescue a pet dog. Though he amazingly survived his attempt at this often deadly action, the intense heat and smoke soon pushed him out of the home, before he could find his pet. He is presently being treated at scene for smoke exposure and minor thermal injury. It is yet unclear if he will accept recommended transportation by ambulance to an area hospital. No other human injuries have been reported. Firefighters continue to search for the man's dog. *** The LAFD reminds you: When there is a fire in your home, quickly crawl low below the heat and smoke and exit the home immediately, closing the door(s) to any unoccupied room behind you as you exit. Once out, stay out! Gather with your family at your predetermined safe outdoor meeting place and stay there. Never re-enter a burning building. If people, pets or possessions remain behind, tell the first arriving firefighters. They are trained, equipped and prepared to rescue them from the flames.*** The cause of this fire remains under investigation.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC18 BC6 CM20 CM22 E10 E13 E15 E203 E215 E220 E226 E26 E29 E3 EM11 HR3 RA29 RA803 RA813 SQ21 T15 T20 T26 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0557; 09:56AM; 953 S Kenmore Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/45z6k82" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/45z6k82</a>; #Koreatown; PRELIM: One-story home well involved with fire, with flames threatening adjacent homes to the north and south.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC6 CM20 CM22 E10 E13 E15 E203 E215 E220 E226 E26 E29 E3 EM11 HR3 RA29 RA803 RA813 SQ21 T15 T20 T26 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12, 13; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0034; 01:04AM; 2016 S Rimpau Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3KNsTwj" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3KNsTwj</a>; #MidCity; Firefighters battled flames in a two-story single-family home. Crews conducted a coordinated effort which took 48 firefighters 44 minutes to extinguish the flames, protecting nearby homes. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC18 CM20 CM22 E226 E26 E261 E294 E34 E61 E68 E94 EA1 RA68 RA826 SO1 T26 T61 T94; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0034; 12:22AM; 2016 S Rimpau Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3KNsTwj" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3KNsTwj</a>; #MidCity; Two-story home with fire showing.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC18 CM20 CM22 E226 E26 E261 E294 E34 E61 E68 E94 RA68 RA826 SO1 T26 T61 T94; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Helicopter Hoist Rescue; INC#1412; 06:31PM; 1 Nike Site; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3i17IHK" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3i17IHK</a>; #Encino; Firefighters have located an adult male mountain biker who sustained an injury on a remote trail (near a former NIKE Missile Control Site near Mullholland Drive and Mandeville Fire Road). LAFD Rescue Helicopter has lowered a flight paramedic to provide treatment and prepare for a hoist operation. The patient will soon be hoisted, followed by the rescuer, for continue in-flight care during direct air transport to an area hospital. ; FS 109; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 AO2 BC10 BP109 E109 E293 E93 H1 H7 HA1 HA7 HL1 RA83 RA93 RH114 T93; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1306; 05:54PM; 3322 N Barham Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3RxY6qU" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3RxY6qU</a>; #HollywoodHills; Firefighters investigating the source of the smoke inside of the two-story fourplex found a small fire involving contents only (no structural involvement yet). Crews quickly snuffed out the small fire, and will remain on scene to evacuate the smoke from the building using blowers. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 76; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC14 BC5 E227 E260 E41 E60 E76 E82 RA76 RA86 SO1 T27 T60; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange
